SEARCH
Package librarySE.core

Class Journal

java.lang.Object
librarySE.core.AbstractLibraryItem
librarySE.core.Journal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Borrowable, LibraryItem, Searchable
public class Journal extends AbstractLibraryItem
Represents a LibraryItem of type Journal (periodical or magazine) within the library system.

Each journal includes identifying and descriptive information such as a title, editor, and issue number. Core responsibilities such as:

  • Unique identity (UUID)
  • Price management with validation
  • Thread-safe borrowing and returning
  • Tracking total and available copies
are inherited from AbstractLibraryItem, so this class focuses mainly on journal-specific metadata and configuration.

Key Features

  • Encapsulates metadata for journals (title, editor, issue number).
  • Supports keyword-based search across title, editor, and issue number.
  • Validates all textual input via ValidationUtils.
  • Uses “smart price” logic with configuration defaults via Config.
  • Fully compatible with fine strategies (e.g., 21 days, 15 NIS/day) through the shared LibraryItem interface.

Price Initialization

When constructing a journal:

  • If a positive price is provided, it is used directly.
  • If price is null or zero, a default is read from Config key "price.journal.default".
  • If no configuration is found, the price falls back to 0.00.

Example Usage


 Journal j = new Journal(
         "AI Research Monthly",
         "Dr. Smith",
         "Vol. 15",
         BigDecimal.valueOf(29.99),
         3
 );

 System.out.println(j);
 // [JOURNAL] AI Research Monthly [Vol. 15] edited by Dr. Smith
 // (Price:29.99, Available:3/3) — Available
Author:
Malak

      public Journal(String title, String editor, String issueNumber, BigDecimal price)
      Constructs a new Journal with a single copy and smart price initialization.
      Parameters:
      title - journal title (non-null, non-empty)
      editor - journal editor (non-null, non-empty)
      issueNumber - issue/volume identifier (non-null, non-empty)
      price - explicit price, or configuration/default if null or zero

    • Journal

      public Journal(String title, String editor, String issueNumber, BigDecimal price, int totalCopies)
      Constructs a new Journal with a specified number of total copies and smart price initialization.
      Parameters:
      title - journal title (non-null, non-empty)
      editor - journal editor (non-null, non-empty)
      issueNumber - issue/volume identifier (non-null, non-empty)
      price - explicit price, or configuration/default if null or zero
      totalCopies - total physical copies (> 0)
